intro: Diplycosia undata, commonly known as the undulate diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly undulating margin. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically greenish-yellow and appear in clusters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its dispersal in its natural habitat.
